meanings.definition: To add too much salt to something.
meanings.sent1: She kept oversalting the soup, making it too salty to eat.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally oversalted the pasta while cooking dinner last night.
meanings.sent3: The chef oversalted the dish so much that even the salt shaker would be jealous.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like oversalting a wound, reopening old hurts.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of oversalting the food were immediate - no one could eat it.

meanings.sent1: His oversalting of the meat made it almost inedible.
meanings.sent2: The oversalting of the popcorn made it too salty to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: The oversalting of the sidewalk in winter made it look like a snowy salt mine.
meanings.sent4: The oversalting of the conversation with jokes made it hard to take seriously.
meanings.sent5: The oversalting of the salad turned it into a salt lick rather than a meal.
